required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics, of MEDI6012 in Subjects With Stable Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Single- Ascending Doses of MEDI6012 in Subjects With Stable Coronary Artery Disease

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 2a Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Single-Ascending Doses of MEDI6012 in Subjects with Stable Coronary Artery Disease

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability of MEDI6012
primary_outcome.description: Measured by Treatment emergent adverse events and serious adverse events

primary_outcome.measure: Number of MEDI6012 subjects with clinically important changes in 12-lead ECG
primary_outcome.description: ECG parameters will be assessed and summarized descriptively by treatment group.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of MEDI6012 subjects with clinically important changes in vital signs
primary_outcome.description: Vital signs results will be summarized using descriptive statistics at each time point by treatment group

primary_outcome.measure: Number of MEDI6012 subjects with clinically important changes in clinical laboratory parameters
primary_outcome.description: Clinical laboratory results including serum chemistry, hematology, and others will be summarized using descriptive statistics at each timepoint by treatment group with placebo group combined. Change in baseline to each post baseline timepoint in these data will also be summarized, where appropriate.
Baseline adjusted AUC post dose in HDL-C

secondary_outcome.description: Non-compartmental analysis will be performed for MEDI6012 treated subjects. Descriptive statistics for PK parameters will be provided.
Non-compartmental analysis will be performed for MEDI6012 treated subjects. Descriptive statistics for PK parameters will be provided.
Non-compartmental analysis will be performed for MEDI6012 treated subjects. Descriptive statistics for PK parameters will be provided.
Non-compartmental analysis will be performed for MEDI6012 treated subjects. Descriptive statistics for PK parameters will be provided.
Baseline adjusted AUC post dose in HDL-C, TC, FC, CE, HDL-CE, HDL-C-UC, Non-HDL-CE, Non-HDL-UC, LDL-C(by direct measure), apoB,
Baseline adjusted AUC post dose in HDL-C, TC, FC, CE, HDL-CE, HDL-C-UC, Non-HDL-CE, Non-HDL-UC, LDL-C(by direct measure), apoB
ADA incidence rate and titer will be tabulated for each treatment group. Samples confirmed positive for ADA will be tested and analyzed for nAb titer and summarized similarly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women 40 - 75 years old
- History of Stable CAD
- Currently receiving statin as standard of care
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe angina pectoris symptoms
- High-risk coronary or carotid artery disease that will likely require surgical or percutaneous intervention during the study period
- Hospitalization for heart failure within 12 months prior to screening
- Uncontrolled Hypertension
- Within 6 months prior to screening, a history of ACS or hospitalization for heart failure
- Clinically significant abnormalities in rhythm, conduction or morphology of ECG
- Subjects with transplanted heart, left ventricular assist device, implanted pacemaker, implantable cardioverter defibrillator, or cardiac resynchronization therapy
- Untreated life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias
- History, within 12 months prior to screening, of myocarditis or restrictive pericarditis, or hemodynamically significant valvular hear disease or aortic disease
- Undergone major surgery with in 3 months prior to screening or has planned major surgery during the study period
